alert.note: Alert for Coahoma (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:28AM CST until March 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 AM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN LEE...NORTHERN COAHOMA...TUNICA AND SOUTHWESTERN TATE COUNTIES... At 327 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Tunica, or 15 miles east of St Francis National Park, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tunica, North Tunica, Dundee, Phillipp, Strayhorn, Dubbs, Little Texas, Dooley, Savage, Maud, Fox Island, Austin, Jeffries, Clayton, Hollywood, Lost Lake, Prichard, Hamlin, Powell and Evansville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
